Topic Modeling for Humans with gensim.
Large scale efficient topic modeling in R and Python.


Installation Reference

Example

Below we build a very basic Latent Dirichlet Allocation model aiming for 2 latent dimensions using example data.

library(gensimr)

# example data
corpus <- common_corpus(to_r = FALSE)
dict <- common_dictionary(to_r = FALSE)

# latent similarity index
lda <- model_lda(corpus, id2word = dict, num_topics = 2L)
topics <- lda$print_topics() # get topics

Objects returned by the package are not automatically converted to R data structures, please use reticulate::py_to_r as shown below.

reticulate::py_to_r(topics) # convert to R format
#> [[1]]
#> [[1]][[1]]
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> [[1]][[2]]
#> [1] "0.154*\"system\" + 0.108*\"graph\" + 0.095*\"eps\" + 0.093*\"trees\" + 0.093*\"user\" + 0.087*\"minors\" + 0.084*\"survey\" + 0.066*\"response\" + 0.065*\"time\" + 0.060*\"human\""
#> 
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [[2]][[1]]
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[2]][[2]]
#> [1] "0.117*\"computer\" + 0.107*\"interface\" + 0.105*\"user\" + 0.105*\"trees\" + 0.093*\"human\" + 0.085*\"time\" + 0.085*\"response\" + 0.081*\"graph\" + 0.073*\"system\" + 0.057*\"survey\""

We can then use our model to transform our corpus and then the document topic matrix.

corpus_wrapped <- wrap(lda, corpus)
get_docs_topics(corpus_wrapped)
#> # A tibble: 9 x 4
#>   dimension_1_x dimension_1_y dimension_2_x dimension_2_y
#>           <dbl>         <dbl>         <dbl>         <dbl>
#> 1             0         0.148             1         0.852
#> 2             0         0.543             1         0.457
#> 3             0         0.794             1         0.206
#> 4             0         0.869             1         0.131
#> 5             0         0.228             1         0.772
#> 6             0         0.474             1         0.526
#> 7             0         0.726             1         0.274
#> 8             0         0.826             1         0.174
#> 9             0         0.848             1         0.152
